dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: DeepSeek rattled Big Tech. Here's what the CEOs of Apple, Meta and Microsoft are saying
News Content: The DeepSeek app is displayed on an iPhone screen. - Illustration: Justin Sullivan (Getty Images)

Earlier this week, Chinese artificial intelligence startup DeepSeek sparked a sell-off of global tech stocks that lost the AI-driven stock rally $1 trillion in value.

The Hangzhou-based company launched its open-source DeepSeek-R1 AI reasoning models the previous week, declaring them on par with those from OpenAI and Anthropic. In December, the startup released DeepSeek-V3, an AI model it said cost just $5.6 million to train and develop on just under 2,050 of Nvidia’s (NVDA) reduced-capability H800 chips. V3, according to the startup’s technical paper, performed comparably to OpenAI’s GPT-4o and Meta’s (META) Llama 3.1 models, which use a much larger quantity of Nvidia’s more powerful chips.

DeepSeek’s cheaper-yet-competitive models have raised questions over Big Tech’s big spending on AI infrastructure. Unsurprisingly, the Chinese startup made its way into Big Tech earnings calls this week, and the chief executives of Microsoft, Meta, and Apple took an optimistic tone while discussing what DeepSeek’s models could mean for the industry.

Here’s what Big Tech is saying about DeepSeek.

Microsoft

Despite launching an investigation this week over whether a group associated with DeepSeek obtained data output from OpenAI’s AI models in violation of the startup’s terms of service, Microsoft launched DeepSeek-R1 on its Azure AI Foundry (MSFT) and GitHub.

Microsoft chief executive Satya Nadella said during the company’s earnings call on Wednesday that developers will also be able to run the startup’s distilled reasoning models on Copilot+ PCs soon.

In response to an analyst’s question about DeepSeek, Nadella said he thinks it “has had some real innovations.” As AI reasoning models such as those from DeepSeek and OpenAI get “commoditized” and “broadly used,” Nadella said customers will be “the big beneficiaries” of that software cycle.

“When token prices fall, inference computing prices fall, that means people can consume more, and there will be more apps written,” Nadella said.

Meta

Meta chief executive Mark Zuckerberg, who touts open-source AI models as “good for the world,” said during the company’s earnings call on Wednesday that DeepSeek did “a number of novel things” with its open-source models that the industry is “still digesting,” and that the startup has made “advances that we will hope to implement in our systems.”

“That’s part of the nature of how this works,” he said, “whether it’s a Chinese competitor or not.”

However, Zuckerberg said it’s too early to have a strong opinion on what DeepSeek means for the trajectory of Meta’s plans for AI infrastructure and capital expenditures.

La historia continúa

Earlier this month, Zuckerberg said Meta is planning to invest between $60 billion and $65 billion in capex on AI this year. The company is also building a data center with a capacity of more than two gigawatts, he said — a site that could cover a large part of Manhattan. Meta plans to bring about one gigawatt of compute online this year, Zuckerberg said, and will end the year with more than 1.3 million graphics processing units, or GPUs.

Apple

While Apple (AAPL) stock avoided the DeepSeek sell-off, Apple chief executive Tim Cook was asked by an analyst for his “worldly perspective” on the AI startup and its implications for the iPhone maker’s business.

“In general, I think innovation that drives efficiency is a good thing,” Cook said. “You know, that’s what you see in that model.”

However, Apple is facing another problem in China, with its revenue being down 11% year over year for the quarter ended in December.

For the latest news, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

Ver comentarios

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55,Reasoning: {'model_name': 'openai/gpt-4o-mini', 'round': 0, 'rise_prediction': 0.45, 'fall_prediction': 0.55, 'reasoning': "The news highlights a competitive threat from DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup that has developed cost-effective AI models, which could impact the spending and revenue potential of major tech companies, including Apple. However, Apple has not been directly affected by the sell-off and its CEO expressed a positive view on innovation driving efficiency. Additionally, the overall sentiment from other tech CEOs is optimistic about the benefits of commoditized AI models. Despite facing challenges in China with declining revenue, the lack of immediate negative impact on Apple's stock suggests a balanced outlook. Therefore, the probabilities reflect a cautious optimism with a slight edge towards stability rather than significant movement."}
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6,Reasoning: {'model_name': 'google/gemini-2.0-flash-001', 'round': 0, 'rise_prediction': 0.4, 'fall_prediction': 0.6, 'reasoning': "The news presents a mixed bag for Apple (AAPL). On one hand, the emergence of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup offering competitive AI models at a lower cost, could potentially pressure Apple to innovate more efficiently and potentially reduce its AI infrastructure spending in the long run. Tim Cook's comment about innovation driving efficiency being a good thing suggests Apple is aware of this trend and potentially open to adapting. However, the news also mentions Apple's revenue being down 11% year-over-year in China, which is a significant concern. While the DeepSeek news itself didn't directly cause a sell-off in Apple stock, the broader implications for the AI landscape and Apple's existing challenges in China create uncertainty. Given the mixed signals, I believe the probability of a stock price rise or fall is relatively balanced, with a slight edge towards a potential fall due to the existing revenue concerns in China."}
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45,Reasoning: {'model_name': 'google/gemini-flash-1.5', 'round': 0, 'rise_prediction': 0.35, 'fall_prediction': 0.45, 'reasoning': "The news focuses on DeepSeek's impact on Big Tech, with Apple CEO Tim Cook offering a generally positive but non-committal response.  While Cook mentions that innovation driving efficiency is good, his statement lacks specifics regarding Apple's plans or how DeepSeek directly affects Apple's business.  The news also highlights Apple's existing challenges in China, with an 11% year-over-year revenue decline. This negative factor counteracts any potential positive sentiment from Cook's comments.  The overall impact of DeepSeek on Apple is unclear, and the news doesn't provide a strong catalyst for either a significant price rise or fall. Therefore, the probabilities are weighted towards a neutral stance, with a slight lean towards a price fall due to the existing challenges in China."}
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6,Reasoning: {'model_name': 'deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324', 'round': 0, 'rise_prediction': 0.4, 'fall_prediction': 0.6, 'reasoning': "The news discusses the impact of DeepSeek's AI models on Big Tech companies, including Apple. While Apple's CEO Tim Cook expressed a positive view on innovation driving efficiency, the company is facing revenue declines in China, a critical market. The stock avoided the initial sell-off, but the mixed signals (positive innovation outlook vs. revenue decline) suggest cautious investor sentiment."}
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45,Reasoning: {'model_name': 'meta-llama/llama-4-scout', 'round': 0, 'rise_prediction': 0.55, 'fall_prediction': 0.45, 'reasoning': "The news discusses the impact of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, on Big Tech companies including Apple. DeepSeek's open-source AI models, which are competitive yet cheaper, have raised questions about Big Tech's spending on AI infrastructure. However, the CEOs of Apple, Meta, and Microsoft have taken an optimistic tone regarding DeepSeek's models. Apple's CEO, Tim Cook, views innovation that drives efficiency as a good thing. Despite this, Apple faces challenges in China with an 11% year-over-year revenue decline. Given the neutral to positive tone from Apple's CEO and the lack of direct negative impact on Apple from DeepSeek's announcements, the probability of Apple's stock price rising is higher than falling. However, the overall tech sector's reaction and Apple's existing challenges in China will influence the stock price movement."}
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45,Reasoning: {'model_name': 'meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct', 'round': 0, 'rise_prediction': 0.55, 'fall_prediction': 0.45, 'reasoning': "The news article discusses the emergence of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, and its potential impact on Big Tech companies, including Apple. The CEOs of Microsoft, Meta, and Apple have taken an optimistic tone, highlighting the potential benefits of DeepSeek's innovations, such as increased efficiency and reduced costs. However, the article also mentions that Apple's revenue in China was down 11% year over year, which could be a concern. Given the overall positive tone from the CEOs and the potential for AI innovations to drive growth, I estimate that the probability of Apple's stock price rising is slightly higher than the probability of it falling."}
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3,Reasoning: {'model_name': 'qwen/qwen-turbo', 'round': 0, 'rise_prediction': 0.4, 'fall_prediction': 0.3, 'reasoning': "The financial news discusses the impact of DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, on global tech stocks. Apple's CEO, Tim Cook, acknowledges the positive aspects of AI innovation but mentions challenges in China. Given Apple's strong market position and the neutral stance taken by Cook, the overall impact on Apple's stock is likely to be minimal."}


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news about DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, and its impact on Big Tech companies is mixed. While DeepSeek's cost-effective AI models could potentially pressure Apple and other tech giants to innovate more efficiently, Apple's CEO Tim Cook expressed a positive view on innovation driving efficiency. However, Apple is facing challenges in China with an 11% year-over-year revenue decline. Considering the neutral to positive tone from tech CEOs and the existing challenges in China, I estimate that the probability of Apple's stock price rising is slightly higher than falling, but with a cautious outlook due to revenue concerns.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "DeepSeek rattled Big Tech. Here's what the CEOs of Apple, Meta and Microsoft are saying",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.48,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.52
}
```
